alert.note: Alert for Antelope Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 31 at 7:45AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... The Flood Watch continues for * A portion of southwest California, including the following areas, Antelope Valley, Los Angeles County Mountains, Santa Clarita Valley, and Ventura County Mountains. * Through this evening * WHEN...From 10 AM PDT this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Debris flows may be a concern in and around the Bobcat, Lake, Ranch 2 and Dam Burn areas.
info.instruction: A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.
